info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 01 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN NEWBERRY...NORTHWESTERN LEXINGTON AND EAST CENTRAL SALUDA COUNTIES... At 655 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dreher Island State Park, or 8 miles northeast of Batesburg-Leesville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Dreher Island State Park, Chapin, Cedar Grove Fire Station, South Shore Marina, Oswald Park, Shull Island, Bundrick Island, Putnam`s Landing, Siesta Cove Marina, Rocky Point Recreation Area, Lake Murray Shores, Circle Fire Station, Delmar, Hollow Creek Public Park, Melvin Park and Riverbend Boat Ramp. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Murray move away from the water and take shelter!
